availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Fielding Vaughn, Jr. (Hart County, Kentucky, merchant.)

body.p: Hart County, Kentucky, merchant. Kentucky native. Son of Fielding Vaughn, Sr., and Eliza Gum Vaughn. Married to Elizabeth Goff Vaughn in Green County, Kentucky, in November 1847. Father of Melissa Vaughn, William W. Vaughn, John M. Vaughn, Elizabeth Vaughn, Laura J. Vaughn, Julia A. Vaughn, Jacob Vaughn, and Myra Vaughn. Laborer in Green County, Kentucky, in 1850. Resident of Hart County, Kentucky, in 1858. Merchant in Hart County in 1860. Employed Elizabeth Hudgeons as a servant in Hart County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Green County, District 2, p. 150B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hart County, District 2, p. 832.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hart County, Powder Mill District, p. 368A-B.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll 994038, Hart County Births.
Kentucky, County Marriages, 1797-1954, Genealogical Society of Salt Lake City, Salt Lake City, UT, Green County Marriages, Film 000594645.
"Fielding Vaughn (1825-1903)," Find A Grave, Memorial 87473334, accessed March 31, 2023, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/87473334.
